newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Sales slow, bids down.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Sales slow, bids down.

text.p: Dark northern spring wheat and soft white wheat bids were mostly lower again Tuesday in reaction to lower Minneapolis wheat futures, dealers said.
MGE May spring wheat closed down three cents at $4.09-1/2 a bushel.

The lower bids discouraged farmer selling, and most dealers reported little if any activity. Sharply higher Chicago Board of Trade soybean futures prompted farmer selling of that crop in North Dakota, sources there said.
Planting of spring wheat, durum and barley was about two weeks away in Montana.
North Dakota sources said snow continues to cover fields but is slowly melting.
Minor flooding was reported south and west of Minneapolis, dealers there said.
Price per bushel for 14-pct protein dark northern spring, durum and white wheats, in dollars per bushel:
Spring Chg Durum(m) Chg White Chg
Spring Chg HRW 13pct Chg White Chg
